oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Water, ethanol and carbon dioxide in fractionation and isolation of berry metabolites
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kallio, Heikki
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Processing, packaging and transportation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There is no real need for use of harmful solvents. Water, ethanol and liquid or supercritical carbon dioxide are in most cases enough.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kallio, Heikki (2007) Water, ethanol and carbon dioxide in fractionation and isolation of berry metabolites. Paper at: Beneficial health substances from berries and minor crops - how to increase their concentration in cultivated species, eliminate losses in processing and enhance dietary use : NJF seminar 399, Piikki√∂, Finland, 14-15 March 2007.
